title: Demi Lovato mourns the loss of friend over one year after her overdose: 'Addiction is NO joke'
text:
Demi Lovato mourned the loss of a friend who struggled with addiction.

The 27-year-old singer took to her Instagram Story on Wednesday night to pay tribute to her friend named Thomas.

The posts come nearly 15-months after she was hospitalized due to drug overdose as she shared black and white snaps of her 'boo' with a heartfelt tribute caption.

She wrote: 'Devastated. Please hold your loved ones tight. Tell them they are special and that you love them. Make sure they know it. RIP to my boo @sirtruss [three heart emojis]'

Sad: Demi Lovato, 27, took to her Instagram Story on Wednesday night to pay tribute to her friend named Thomas

'Devastated': The posts come nearly 15-months after she was hospitalized due to drug overdose as she shared black and white snaps of her 'boo' with a heartfelt tribute caption

As she is in recovery herself, she urged her 74.5million followers to ask for help if they or someone they know is struggling with addiction.

Lovato continued: 'Addiction is NO joke. heaven gained this beautiful angel last night because of that terrible disease. I’m crushed and will always miss you @sirtruss. If you or someone you know is struggling please know it’s okay to ask for help.'

In July 2018, the Sober singer was found unconscious in her Hollywood home.

She was hospitalized for almost two weeks before checking into a treatment center where she broke her silence in a now deleted post to social media.

'Addiction is NO joke': As she is in recovery herself, she urged her 74.5million followers to ask for help if they or someone they know is struggling with addiction

'I want to thank God for keeping me alive and well. I have always been transparent about my journey with addiction,' she explained.

'What I’ve learned is that this illness is not something that disappears or fades with time. It is something I must continue to overcome and have not done yet.'

Since then, the former X-Factor judge has been keeping positive with working out and finding new talent management.

Trials and tribulations: In July 2018, the Sober singer (pictured last week in Jerusalem) was found unconscious in her Hollywood home. She was hospitalized for almost two weeks before checking into a treatment center

She has since signed with Scooter Braun whose impressive client list includes the likes of Ariana Grande, Justin Bieber, and Kanye West.

Back in May she posted a snap of herself with the 38-year-old executive with the caption: 'GUYS!!!!!!! Dreams came true today for me. I officially have a NEW MANAGER!!! And not just any new manager but the one and only @scooterbraun!!!!'

Lovato split from her longtime manager Phil McIntyre of PhillyMack last year.

She has released six studio albums since her smash debut, Don't Forget, in 2008.
